title: Understanding Risk Factors
text: Risk factors are characteristics or conditions that increase the likelihood of developing a mental health disorder. They can be biological, psychological, or social in nature.

title: Examples of Risk Factors
text: Examples of risk factors include genetic predisposition, exposure to trauma, and chronic stress. These factors can vary in their impact and may change over time.

hintAnswer: increases the chances of developing a mental illness, may determine the probability of having a $$psychiatric-mental$$ illness, and can change through the life span
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes a risk factor?
choices: increases the chances of developing a mental illness, may determine the probability of having a $$psychiatric-mental$$ illness, and can change through the life span
creates minor issues later in life
